blocks.text: Data in Spark is stored and returned at 2 levels. You are able to create an API key at a company or project level, and depending on the which is submitted with the request, you will receive different data in return:

runs.text: Data in Spark is stored and returned at 2 levels. You are able to create an API key at a company or project level, and depending on the which is submitted with the request, you will receive different data in return:

blocks.text: A company is a real estate developer, marketing firm, or brokerage using the Spark platform. All of our data is separated on a per company basis.

runs.text: A company is a real estate developer, marketing firm, or brokerage using the Spark platform. All of our data is separated on a per company basis.

blocks.text: When accessing the API using a company API key, it will return data for all of the projects that belong to it.

runs.text: When accessing the API using a company API key, it will return data for all of the projects that belong to it.

blocks.text: A project is an indivdual real estate development, usually a single building that is being sold or leased. All projects belong to a single company, but a company can have multiple projects.

runs.text: A project is an indivdual real estate development, usually a single building that is being sold or leased. All projects belong to a single company, but a company can have multiple projects.

blocks.text: When accessing the API using a project API key, it will only return data for that project.

runs.text: When accessing the API using a project API key, it will only return data for that project.

blocks.text: All dates and times are returned following the ISO 8601 (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) standard, in UTC (referred to as Z, meaning zero offset):

runs.text: All dates and times are returned following the
standard, in UTC (referred to as Z, meaning zero offset):

blocks.text: All monetary values are returned in cents:

runs.text: All monetary values are returned in cents:

blocks.text: Prices and other monetary values will need to be converted by moving the decimal place based on the currency you are working with.

runs.text: Prices and other monetary values will need to be converted by moving the decimal place based on the currency you are working with.

blocks.text: For example, to convert to a currency that has 2 decimal places, (like USD/CAD), divide the value by 100.

runs.text: For example, to convert to a currency that has 2 decimal places, (like USD/CAD), divide the value by 100.
